posts.title: FBI ordered to prioritize immigration, as DOJ scales back white collar cases
top_comments: Government full of white collar criminals scales back investigation of white collar criminals.
Sounds like a lot of fraud will be happening unchecked

*But as....Trump has stepped up an immigration crackdown, thousands of federal law enforcement officials from multiple agencies* [*have been*](https://www.reuters.com/world/us/thousands-agents-diverted-trump-immigration-crackdown-2025-03-22/) *enlisted to take on new work as immigration enforcers, pulling crime-fighting resources away from other areas.*

So the DOJ cuts back efforts to prosecute white-collar offenses, as in "public [corruption](https://www.reuters.com/world/us/trumps-justice-department-hits-brakes-anti-corruption-enforcement-2025-02-12/), foreign bribery, kleptocracy and foreign influence."   (so racist, and so self-serving)
The massive tranfer of wealth during covid wasn't enough. They will not stop until we are all slaves.

Sure… why not…. Let the mortgage fraudsters steal my home and life savings.….. just as long as I can rest comfortably knowing the cucumbers in my salad weren’t sullied by the hands of an undocumented farm worker getting paid 1/2 minimum wage to do back breaking labor in the hot sun.
It's corruption all the way down.
So Republicans are seriously dismantling the rule of law in broad daylight, openly and proverbial crickets?!?!?

Super excited that we're going after people that are having a net positive impact on society rather than the group that is systematically siphoning off every single resource they can for themselves. We really need to take a page from the French.
Just want to point out solving and therefore preventing white collar crime actually generates money and lost tax revenue.
Let’s not investigate where all the hundreds million $’s of Trump’s inauguration fund went to.  Or who were the early buyers of Trump coin

posts.title: FDA and RFK Jr. aim to remove ingestible fluoride products used to protect kids' teeth
top_comments:
I work in peds dentistry and trust me, parents are already saying no to fluoride and no to radiographs...and often they are spending thousands in treatments for composites, pulpotomies, etc. that could have been prevented. Dental health is overlooked so often in favor of extracirriculars. "Sorry, Timmy has baseball practice so we need to reschedule/cancel." Ok, so Timmy is 7 years old, is a high caries risk, and hasn't seen us in 2 years. I think he can miss one fucking practice. People's priorities are alllll outta whack.

We get a lot of "they won't let me brush their teeth!" too. I'm sorry, who is the parent here? They're a small child, they need your guidance. I am empathetic to a point but you have to do it. If they didn't want to shit in the toilet, would you let them do it outside too? 

I fear we are going to get a lot busier. 🥺

EDIT:

Wow ok, did not expect my comment to blow up. I just want to let yall know that I feel you on multiple fronts. I have a background in dental assisting, veterinary dentistry,  medical and dental research but now I work in the admin side of dentistry (not a dentist), so the financial issues and insurance issues I deal with on a daily basis are frustrating and heart breaking. It was the same when I worked in veterinary. As much as I wish we could do this fully subsidized, the USA hates universal health care and we have to make money to feed our staff. A lot of dentists, including my own, are eschewing being in network with a lot of insurances because they pay literal pennies for procedures. I'm talking about 15-20 bucks for full surgical procedures, which with how much dental school costs...it's not economical. I highly suggest to find a dentist that has a membership plan, it is often more cost effective than dental premiums!

As for health, if you truly don't want to give your kid flouride, there are alternatives that are NOT charcoal (seriously, don't! especially if theyre on meds!). Boka has nano hydroxyapatite toothpaste that has been clinically studied and is a great alternative. But I must insist you get radiographs, as the tooth is like an iceburg. A lot goes on underneath the surface. 

Dentistry shouldn't be a luxury. I myself have talked to my local representatives about health care and dental care being my top concern and how we are doing nothing about it. My state, CA, can do better and I want it to be better. I wish I had all the solutions, I wish everyone here can get care. But please, do not yell at the staff if insurance isn't covering procedures. We literally can't control it. 😭 And I work with a dentist who would rather never see a cavity again. It is devastating to tell a parent their kid needs several crowns, pulpotomies, composites under anesthesia.
So now you’re taking my choice away as to how to best protect my kids’ health? Fuck you.

My dentist literally prescribed me an extra-fluoride toothpaste to help with back molars... while RFK Jr is pushing this idiocy.

At this point I'm half-expecting Trump to appoint a 'czar of software'.. who just installs backdoors into agencies, wrecks the systems, and steals all the data.

*oh wait.*

> Instead, the FDA will ask manufacturers to voluntarily pull their products, according to an administration official.

If I was a manufacturer, my reply to that ask would be "fuck you."

> FDA Commissioner Marty Makary said the products pose a risk when swallowed because they may interfere with healthy gut bacteria that are critical to digestion, immunity and other key bodily functions. 

Meanwhile, Brainworm is out there getting MAHA parents to [pump their kids full of vitamin A to toxic levels](https://www.washingtonpost.com/wellness/2025/04/07/vitamin-a-poisoning-measles-rfk-jr/).

Government falling from the stupid tree and hitting every branch on the way down.
Wait til they hear about chlorine and its effects on beneficial bacteria.
And when kids’ teeth start getting more unhealthy, the same parents who cheer for this will complain and blame literally anyone else.
What happened to all those anti-vaxxers yelling “my body, my choice” now that the government is dictating what they can and cannot have?
The idiot shouldn’t be in charge of our country’s health
do I need to hoard fluoride toothpaste now?
I don't understand. There are fluoride-free mouthwashes and toothpastes already on the market. Some of us want fluoride toothpaste/mouth washes.

posts.title: Grand jury indicts Milwaukee County judge after prosecutors allege she helped a man evade ICE
top_comments: In summary, an administrative warrant is issued by a government agency for regulatory or administrative purposes, while a judicial warrant is issued by a court for criminal or civil law enforcement.

As the old saying goes, a grand jury would indict a ham sandwich if that’s what the prosecutor wanted.

Grand jury indictments are just a rubber stamp.
All governmental officials should be held to account. Let's start with, idk, maybe the fucking President?

I’ve served on a grand jury and can clearly explain what happens there. Grand juries do not need proof beyond a reasonable doubt, they just need to be presented with enough evidence to lead a reasonable person to believe there’s enough evidence to charge somebody with a crime. The bar is much lower to indict somebody.

> Prosecutors allege she broke federal law by helping a man evade immigration enforcement last month.

Legal Eagle did a great breakdown on this whole case. The funniest part is that the door she let the man “escape” through led…right back to the main hallway where officers were waiting lol

So basically they’re going to argue either she didn’t know how her own courthouse hallways work, or somehow she did know and it still counts as helping him “escape” by leading him straight back to them!

EDIT: For people wanting to dispute what I say above, please watch [the Legal Eagle video](https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=TPQeZalnArY&pp=0gcJCYsJAYcqIYzv) before doing so.

This is crazy. She let him out through a different exit that lead to the SAME public hallway as where the ICE agents were waiting. The agents even rode down the elevator with the guy and his lawyer before they arrested him outside.
Hope democrats remember this next time they debate 3 years whether to charge Trump or any republican for any of the crimes they commit.
Sounds like someone is getting due process.

Once you guys get rid of that pesky legal system you have, and kill the media, you’re done. 

Currently you’re already done for tourism $$$. 🤔
Reminder: the people who hid Anne Frank were breaking the law, the Nazis that killed her were following the law.

Good time to remind everyone to get checked regularly.

I feel like this information has just been forced upon me against my will.

posts.title: NZ travellers warned of increased detention risk at US border.
top_comments:
I’m a NZ’er born & raised. I’ve lived in the US 24yrs & am a dual NZ/US citizen. When I arrived back in the US on my US Passport about 5 years ago, the Immigration Officer looked at my passport (again US CITIZEN on a US PASSPORT) & said, “*Where are you from?*” 

Me: “*Montana - just returning home.*” 

Him: “*I didn’t ask where you live, I asked where you’re from.*” 

Me: “*I’m originally from New Zealand.*”

Him: “*THAT’s where you’re from. You’re not from Montana - that’d be good for you to remember. Most Americans don’t have 2 middle names. NEXT!*” 👋🏽🤨

I’ve arrived in the US many, many times as a non-citizen *before* all this hullabaloo started & it was bad enough then. But THIS is how they treat US citizens - think about how bad it’s going to be now for foreign visitors.
The United States is not a safe place for foreigners.
Amazing how quickly the US turned into a shithole country
I have friends who were coming from Europe to SGF in California next month that have cancelled because they don’t wanna risk it. This sucks.
Welcome to the club NZ!
The travel agencies and airlines should have to stop advertising deals to the US, too, as it’s just encouraging a very unsafe activity.
I certainly wouldn’t visit from another country. I wouldn’t recommend it at all.
“This is gonna ruin the tour.” - Lorde
Our governed right now is the world's most powerful criminal organization....it ain't safe here
Strange how the article mentions they’ve had issues since November 2024. Seems like it’s been a bipartisan issue.

posts.title: Judge agrees to resentence Menendez brothers over 1989 murders
top_comments:
>Judge Michael Jesic gave Erik and Lyle Menendez a new sentence of 50 years to life. A decision on their potential release will be made at a parole hearing in June.

Their previous sentence had no possibility of parole. That's the major change, here.
Why is the Picture black & white. We had colour in the 80
That's a lot of murders
Reddit has a weird fetish with upper middle class murderers.

Father was extremely abusive, sexual and emotionally. Other family members corroborated that. The mother was more abusive with the oldest son and the father with the youngest. 

One anecdote is that their father killed their pet bunny for Christ’s sake. 

They should not have killed them but they have been punished enough.
Ok just 40 more years
Netflix documentary came out about them.
They had a great time at the Lakers game

As a guy who was sexually abused,I can tell you the double standard is real, Judging by the record, they have not been in trouble since in the jail, they have actually helped a lot of people and they seem remorseful. So why shouldn't they at least get the possibility of a second chance.

My brother was horrifically sexually abused by his father, which led to my brother’s death in his early 20s. But he didn’t kill his dad. 

But then, his dad wasn’t wealthy, like the Menendez parents.

posts.title: UnitedHealth suspends annual forecast, CEO Andrew Witty steps down
top_comments: My company recently moved insurance from Blue Cross/Blue Shield over to this hot mess. Man, when I tell ya…absolutely *dog shit* insurance company. We went from pretty good coverage to them nickel and diming over everything. Would strongly advise to stay away from UnitedHealth.
I hope UnitedHealth continues to go under. Awful company. Their denial rate is 2x that of the industry average. Total scam of a company

"CEO Andrew Witty steps down"

'Hey guys, make sure EVERYONE knows I'm not CEO of UnitedHealth anymore. Issue press releases, take out ads, maybe put up a banner with the new guys face on it....'

[Understanding the Change Healthcare Breach and Its Impact on Security Compliance](https://hyperproof.io/resource/understanding-the-change-healthcare-breach/)

In short, quite possibly the largest healthcare data breach in history occurred under his watch.
Sounds like fall out from the lawsuit. Good thing stockholders get taken care of. God forbid someone does anything to prevent another CEO being killed. All about those dollar bills.

> surging medical costs send its shares plunging more than 11%

Which is a perfect example of why medical care should not be a for-profit enterprise.
In simple terms, my rates are going up, big time
This was moments after the board voted against metal detectors outside annual forecast meetings
Maybe healthcare shouldn't be tied to a stock ticker?

I never buy personal reasons.  Had a few people leave my company like that.  One cared way too much and it showed as she was doing her two weeks.  She finally told us it was a silent layoff.  Our boss left for personal reasons with no job at the same time.  

Shit is going sideways after the shooting and this guy either wasnt doing what he needed/asked to do or he just fucked it all up and the board said time to go.  

He could have something personal too.  He’s human.  But with the other stuff.  Seems like board asked him to leave.

posts.title: Georgia college student remains in ICE custody after mistaken traffic stop
top_comments:
I'd like to know how she ended up in ICE custody. She gets pulled over by mistake (charges have already been dismissed), and then what? Are the cops asking for the immigration status of everyone they pull over? Was she driving without a DL which triggers inquiry and then ICE arrives to detain her while they figure out if she's legal? Same with her father who got pulled over going 19mph over the limit. For most people, this is a ticket and then you go home. What is going on between them getting pulled over and detained so they end up with ICE? Because ICE can't pull people over.

There is no central registry of citizens. The only documents which prove your citizenship are your passport, naturalization certificate, or birth certificate, which most people don't carry with them at all times.. Which to me means that cops are looping in ICE on anyone they may suspect to be undocumented... and I don't see how that isn't effectively just racial profiling on Latinos in the United States.

The article makes it sound like she actually is and always has been undocumented. I'm asking because I truly have no idea; how does an undocumented person obtain a driver's license and enroll in a university?

Reading the article it says she’s been in the U.S. since she was 4yo but her parents say she couldn’t register under DACA since the program ended. I thought DACA is technically still in place? Or at least it shouldve been 10 years ago unless I’m reading this wrong
This is beyond scary at this point.
[removed]

Yeeep. There was another case of someone getting "accidentally" taken in by ICE only to find out there's a mandatory 48 hour holding period no exceptions in Florida I think? 

Basically if ICE or cops working with ICE want to grab you off the street even if you have full citizenship and papers to prove you are a citizen you have to lose 48 hours of your life in a cell regardless.

And if such policy is imposed specifically on Hispanic people for the suspicion of being undocumented people from south America well...

Being Hispanic is technically still legal. But functionally? Up for debate depending on the mood of people with all the authority in the world to fuck up your life at least for a few days at a time.
19 mph over is a violent offender?
welcome to a USA where everyone who looks a little too brown can be detained by ICE.

"We're going after violent criminals and gangs"

*Goes after working families and students*

We legals have nothing to worry about?  
  Yeah, sure...  
  
EDIT:  
Hey clowns, I never said she was legal.  Learn to read and stop making false assumptions.

posts.title: FDA and RFK Jr. aim to remove ingestible fluoride products used to protect kids' teeth
top_comments:
I work in peds dentistry and trust me, parents are already saying no to fluoride and no to radiographs...and often they are spending thousands in treatments for composites, pulpotomies, etc. that could have been prevented. Dental health is overlooked so often in favor of extracirriculars. "Sorry, Timmy has baseball practice so we need to reschedule/cancel." Ok, so Timmy is 7 years old, is a high caries risk, and hasn't seen us in 2 years. I think he can miss one fucking practice. People's priorities are alllll outta whack.

We get a lot of "they won't let me brush their teeth!" too. I'm sorry, who is the parent here? They're a small child, they need your guidance. I am empathetic to a point but you have to do it. If they didn't want to shit in the toilet, would you let them do it outside too? 

I fear we are going to get a lot busier. 🥺

EDIT:

Wow ok, did not expect my comment to blow up. I just want to let yall know that I feel you on multiple fronts. I have a background in dental assisting, veterinary dentistry,  medical and dental research but now I work in the admin side of dentistry (not a dentist), so the financial issues and insurance issues I deal with on a daily basis are frustrating and heart breaking. It was the same when I worked in veterinary. As much as I wish we could do this fully subsidized, the USA hates universal health care and we have to make money to feed our staff. A lot of dentists, including my own, are eschewing being in network with a lot of insurances because they pay literal pennies for procedures. I'm talking about 15-20 bucks for full surgical procedures, which with how much dental school costs...it's not economical. I highly suggest to find a dentist that has a membership plan, it is often more cost effective than dental premiums!

As for health, if you truly don't want to give your kid flouride, there are alternatives that are NOT charcoal (seriously, don't! especially if theyre on meds!). Boka has nano hydroxyapatite toothpaste that has been clinically studied and is a great alternative. But I must insist you get radiographs, as the tooth is like an iceburg. A lot goes on underneath the surface. 

Dentistry shouldn't be a luxury. I myself have talked to my local representatives about health care and dental care being my top concern and how we are doing nothing about it. My state, CA, can do better and I want it to be better. I wish I had all the solutions, I wish everyone here can get care. But please, do not yell at the staff if insurance isn't covering procedures. We literally can't control it. 😭 And I work with a dentist who would rather never see a cavity again. It is devastating to tell a parent their kid needs several crowns, pulpotomies, composites under anesthesia.
So now you’re taking my choice away as to how to best protect my kids’ health? Fuck you.

My dentist literally prescribed me an extra-fluoride toothpaste to help with back molars... while RFK Jr is pushing this idiocy.

At this point I'm half-expecting Trump to appoint a 'czar of software'.. who just installs backdoors into agencies, wrecks the systems, and steals all the data.

*oh wait.*

> Instead, the FDA will ask manufacturers to voluntarily pull their products, according to an administration official.

If I was a manufacturer, my reply to that ask would be "fuck you."

> FDA Commissioner Marty Makary said the products pose a risk when swallowed because they may interfere with healthy gut bacteria that are critical to digestion, immunity and other key bodily functions. 

Meanwhile, Brainworm is out there getting MAHA parents to [pump their kids full of vitamin A to toxic levels](https://www.washingtonpost.com/wellness/2025/04/07/vitamin-a-poisoning-measles-rfk-jr/).

Government falling from the stupid tree and hitting every branch on the way down.
Wait til they hear about chlorine and its effects on beneficial bacteria.
And when kids’ teeth start getting more unhealthy, the same parents who cheer for this will complain and blame literally anyone else.
What happened to all those anti-vaxxers yelling “my body, my choice” now that the government is dictating what they can and cannot have?
The idiot shouldn’t be in charge of our country’s health
do I need to hoard fluoride toothpaste now?
I don't understand. There are fluoride-free mouthwashes and toothpastes already on the market. Some of us want fluoride toothpaste/mouth washes.

posts.title: NZ travellers warned of increased detention risk at US border.
top_comments:
I’m a NZ’er born & raised. I’ve lived in the US 24yrs & am a dual NZ/US citizen. When I arrived back in the US on my US Passport about 5 years ago, the Immigration Officer looked at my passport (again US CITIZEN on a US PASSPORT) & said, “*Where are you from?*” 

Me: “*Montana - just returning home.*” 

Him: “*I didn’t ask where you live, I asked where you’re from.*” 

Me: “*I’m originally from New Zealand.*”

Him: “*THAT’s where you’re from. You’re not from Montana - that’d be good for you to remember. Most Americans don’t have 2 middle names. NEXT!*” 👋🏽🤨

I’ve arrived in the US many, many times as a non-citizen *before* all this hullabaloo started & it was bad enough then. But THIS is how they treat US citizens - think about how bad it’s going to be now for foreign visitors.
The United States is not a safe place for foreigners.
Amazing how quickly the US turned into a shithole country
I have friends who were coming from Europe to SGF in California next month that have cancelled because they don’t wanna risk it. This sucks.
Welcome to the club NZ!
The travel agencies and airlines should have to stop advertising deals to the US, too, as it’s just encouraging a very unsafe activity.
I certainly wouldn’t visit from another country. I wouldn’t recommend it at all.
“This is gonna ruin the tour.” - Lorde
Our governed right now is the world's most powerful criminal organization....it ain't safe here

posts.title: Grand jury indicts Milwaukee County judge after prosecutors allege she helped a man evade ICE
top_comments: In summary, an administrative warrant is issued by a government agency for regulatory or administrative purposes, while a judicial warrant is issued by a court for criminal or civil law enforcement.

As the old saying goes, a grand jury would indict a ham sandwich if that’s what the prosecutor wanted.

Grand jury indictments are just a rubber stamp.
All governmental officials should be held to account. Let's start with, idk, maybe the fucking President?

I’ve served on a grand jury and can clearly explain what happens there. Grand juries do not need proof beyond a reasonable doubt, they just need to be presented with enough evidence to lead a reasonable person to believe there’s enough evidence to charge somebody with a crime. The bar is much lower to indict somebody.

> Prosecutors allege she broke federal law by helping a man evade immigration enforcement last month.

Legal Eagle did a great breakdown on this whole case. The funniest part is that the door she let the man “escape” through led…right back to the main hallway where officers were waiting lol

So basically they’re going to argue either she didn’t know how her own courthouse hallways work, or somehow she did know and it still counts as helping him “escape” by leading him straight back to them!

EDIT: For people wanting to dispute what I say above, please watch [the Legal Eagle video](https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=TPQeZalnArY&pp=0gcJCYsJAYcqIYzv) before doing so.

This is crazy. She let him out through a different exit that lead to the SAME public hallway as where the ICE agents were waiting. The agents even rode down the elevator with the guy and his lawyer before they arrested him outside.
Hope democrats remember this next time they debate 3 years whether to charge Trump or any republican for any of the crimes they commit.
Sounds like someone is getting due process.

Once you guys get rid of that pesky legal system you have, and kill the media, you’re done. 

Currently you’re already done for tourism $$$. 🤔
Reminder: the people who hid Anne Frank were breaking the law, the Nazis that killed her were following the law.

posts.title: FDA and RFK Jr. aim to remove ingestible fluoride products used to protect kids' teeth
top_comments:
I work in peds dentistry and trust me, parents are already saying no to fluoride and no to radiographs...and often they are spending thousands in treatments for composites, pulpotomies, etc. that could have been prevented. Dental health is overlooked so often in favor of extracirriculars. "Sorry, Timmy has baseball practice so we need to reschedule/cancel." Ok, so Timmy is 7 years old, is a high caries risk, and hasn't seen us in 2 years. I think he can miss one fucking practice. People's priorities are alllll outta whack.

We get a lot of "they won't let me brush their teeth!" too. I'm sorry, who is the parent here? They're a small child, they need your guidance. I am empathetic to a point but you have to do it. If they didn't want to shit in the toilet, would you let them do it outside too? 

I fear we are going to get a lot busier. 🥺

EDIT:

Wow ok, did not expect my comment to blow up. I just want to let yall know that I feel you on multiple fronts. I have a background in dental assisting, veterinary dentistry,  medical and dental research but now I work in the admin side of dentistry (not a dentist), so the financial issues and insurance issues I deal with on a daily basis are frustrating and heart breaking. It was the same when I worked in veterinary. As much as I wish we could do this fully subsidized, the USA hates universal health care and we have to make money to feed our staff. A lot of dentists, including my own, are eschewing being in network with a lot of insurances because they pay literal pennies for procedures. I'm talking about 15-20 bucks for full surgical procedures, which with how much dental school costs...it's not economical. I highly suggest to find a dentist that has a membership plan, it is often more cost effective than dental premiums!

As for health, if you truly don't want to give your kid flouride, there are alternatives that are NOT charcoal (seriously, don't! especially if theyre on meds!). Boka has nano hydroxyapatite toothpaste that has been clinically studied and is a great alternative. But I must insist you get radiographs, as the tooth is like an iceburg. A lot goes on underneath the surface. 

Dentistry shouldn't be a luxury. I myself have talked to my local representatives about health care and dental care being my top concern and how we are doing nothing about it. My state, CA, can do better and I want it to be better. I wish I had all the solutions, I wish everyone here can get care. But please, do not yell at the staff if insurance isn't covering procedures. We literally can't control it. 😭 And I work with a dentist who would rather never see a cavity again.
